post.titolo: The escape of Antenor from Troy
post.descrizione: The figure of the hero is very evident within the work. Antenor, waiting for the ship that would take them away from the defeated and burned city, is having a conversation with his wife Teucer and his two sons Helicaone and Polydamante. The story is dramatic but the city that can be seen in the background is not represented in dark colours, to underline the tragic nature of the event, but in very light colors which only allow the red of the fire to be glimpsed. Not even the faces show feelings of pain for the devastation and abandonment of the homeland. The only subject whose face bears witness to regret is the old woman positioned behind the hero. A curious aspect of the work is the presence of the date, i.e. 1650, painted in the lower left corner on a bale of hay, where a half-naked woman finds refreshment. The peculiarity of the fresco is to be found in the inscription, unique of its kind, which shows the literal quotation of Virgil's poem "Aeneid" at the base of the painting.
